text: Deck is mostly done. Addressed most of Megan's feedback. I want to add an onboarding screen to call out recipient first and local. I also need cards for 21. A lot of the product card copy sounds like advertisement. I'll try to do a pass to make them sound situationally relevant.
I can add the onboading screen, and am working on cards for 21
have some family stuff this morning, back early afternoon
Thank you both!!
I'll be able to check out the deck in a couple of hours or whenever it makes sense this afternoon

<@U0DCXC37U>. The good news is that either option preserves the intent and spirit of the name Ada.

*AdaZ* did not make sense to me until I actually said it out loud. 
*Ayda* may or may not be read as "Ada."

In the best of all possible worlds, they test both options and go with the one that works for actual users.

Short of that, I'd go with Ayda. My instinct is that this option is less confusing for members.

<@U0GN0A9EV> <@U0HP6TFNX> I went through and did a *cursory edit (i's dotted and t's crossed)* . Also, noticed the following:

 *Slide 7* was a little bit confusing. I get that those are all things that members can purchase. It seems like, in terms of category, the products here are Care Premium, CareExpress and Concierge. The other services can be acquired individually or within the context of the product packages. Is that right? Can we reflect this?
*Before Slide 10* consider signaling this as a new section "Content and Merchandising." It just has a different feel than high-level functionality slide (8) and/or the dashboard high-level view (9).
*Slide 20* is a little bit anomalous. The "content" could be clarified so that it's as solid as the content on the other slides. Also, is "third party integration" a product? I'm not sure it's mentioned as such anywhere else.
*Slide 22* looks like the beginning of another section. Consider inserting another section title slide for "top level navigation." Also, that section parses out the "functionality" (slide 4). Can you somehow bring these things together? Maybe explain during the preso (at slide 4) that they should expect a deeper dive of the functionality toward the end of the talk? Or maybe start with an entire functionality section (I know we've talked about this and there's a good reason not to do it. How can we honor that insight AND cement  the relationship between slide 4 and slide 22- 26)? 

looks super great, you guys!
<@U4VTSDW7P> good point about slide 22 (now slide 23). it does feel naturally related to the setup on the top level functionality - now slide 8
<@U0GN0A9EV> what do you think about including third party integrations as a product? the free zoo day/summer camp scenario?
I've added it to the transitions phase, but I should also add it to the top level page if it's a keeper
I think it's a good idea. keep it. Sheila was excited about it
Cool, I will add - I guess if we do that it'd also make sense in the Care Daily Suggestions, I'll add it there too
yep
I don't know how to steal marketshare from day care. I don't think that's a thing
agree, it might be a byproduct of <http://Care.com|Care.com> being a go-to source, but isn't a product in itself. should we pull that reference from slide 5. It does mess with our "big 5" list

I think that can be implicit, as in all of these things provide benefits in the form of alternatives to daycare. So I agree we can pull it from being called out as a product without taking it out of the big five list.
I'm fine just saying I don't know how to do this yet. Acknowledging that we heard her and thought about it

Yeah, I believe what she means by that, is the entire experience-but namely the existence of nanny share, and the existence of other activities recommended through timelineâ€¦ Like tutors, art classes, etc. The things that daycare offers
Agreed it's not a product in itself

<@U0GN0A9EV> I added the cards on 21, localized data, and reframed onboarding as "evolving recipient profile" with onboarding as an input. 
I looked at our prototype flow, and increasing fidelity on that to represent our script in graphic form, but not feeling it. I think slide 8 plus the prototype have us covered on the overview, and they fit naturally into the flow of the presentation, so I'm inclined to just use those as you have them. But let me know if you feel like we should add a deeper dive on prototype flow and I can add that.
I think it's good! Thanks

Hey folks, the deck is looking really good! Couple of thoughts and questions:

1. <@U4VTSDW7P> The sections on slide 2 aren't feeling like they quite match up to the content in the deck past the Context section. And while I think we'll iterate past this gateway, I'm a little nervous about putting that in writing right upfront. Lastly, since the monetization opportunities are going to be contained in another deck, I'm wondering if we nix that from this table of contents and just match these to our big red slides. Thoughts?

2. I started a doc for the agenda - I'm hoping folks can think through how long these sections will take to get through and assign themselves sections so we know who is driving what tomorrow. (Last time we went over an hour so want to make sure we set aside the right amount of time for the deck then prototype). <@U0HP6TFNX> <@U0GN0A9EV> 

3. Are we at the point where we can delete the slides past Thank You? I'll need to send off the deck at 9am tomorrow so hoping it's ready for me to PDF by then.
<@U026103R3|abby> shared a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/abby/F5E6F7EBZ/15|Concept Gateway Agenda 5/15>

<@U026103R3>, you absolutely do not need that slide for this preso. you could either delete or use that space for a really basic TOC (something that reflects the interstitial title slides). if not, you can just talk them through what you're going to do and then go right into context. helpful?
I'm thinking Ivan will probably run the show entirely tomorrow so I will let him answer the time question
<@U4VTSDW7P> I think it's helpful when we have the sections outlined upfront, so I'll go ahead and update it to just match the interstitial slides like you suggest. Thanks!
yeah grl!

<@U0HP6TFNX> Ok cool, good to know. <@U0GN0A9EV> if you have a chance to think through timing for a sec that'd be rad, otherwise we can touch base before the meeting. 

And if the deck stays as is I'll go ahead and delete the slides after Thank You, make the PDF and send it off to ET tomorrow at 9am unless there are any other objections.
Excited for tomorrow!
i
m excited to hear how it went. for real.
I think the timing looks about right. I plan to keep it tight.
